history.content: One thing you can do is check the past semester websites and see if they clash

children.subject: Also, project 2 isn't a lot of code at all.
Damn, given these descriptions of its projects, is 161 a light technical? Or is the brunt of the workload somewhere else in the course?

It comes in waves. For example, basically 0 people were in office hours this week, but the project has been out for a week. I imagine people are busy for other classes. Next week could be stressful if people are just starting.

I think there is a lot of conceptual material. So although projects give you real experience and a deeper understanding of applying the concepts we learn, there is still a lot to learn. We also have 5 hws, which are only 5-6 problems(usually 2 are T/F, the other 3 are 2-4 short answers), graded on accuracy.

It's not light, because if you just complete the HW's and Projects, there's still a ton of material with many little details.

Project 1 took 2-3 days, but there was only 5-7 lines of code..you're basically trying to steal usernames and passwords and need to figure out the 1 liner. It's possible to feel completely lost, but can easily get ramped up with how the project works.

Project 2 was the easiest for me personally, but it took 4-5 days due to debugging. You basically have to write a file sharing system. The design(considered the bulk of the project) wasn't hard for me, but figuring out which functions to use to implement my design was difficult. Also, writing sufficient tests for sharing and revoking files is crucial, since you might fail many tests if you just use the staff tests. With that being said, this project took many people 1-2 weeks.

Project 3, still in progress, took me 2 days. This one is basically looking through a website and finding vulnerabilities. It can definitely be time consuming and hard, I just got lucky and found them fast.

So if you start all 3 of these projects early, you'll be fine.

I did this combo last semester and it was fine! From what I remember, project deadlines didn't clash at all (although I think midterms might have been close together at some point?), and 161 was significantly less work than 162, especially if you have a good partner. I wouldn't say 161 is a light class, but it's definitely doable as a combo.

history.content: I am considering taking CS 161 and CS 162 next semester. For those who have taken these courses in the past, what is the workload of CS 161? Do project deadlines usually clash?
history.subject: Do CS 161 and CS 162 project deadline usually clash?
